This is the "GLAM" template. It is used by [[Form:GLAM]] and should not be used outside this form. Edit the page to see the template text. __NOEDITSECTION__[[has description::{{{Description|No description entered.}}}]] __TOC__ == Basic data == {| class="swordinfotable" |- ! [[Property:Is instance of|Instance of]]: | [[Is instance of::GLAM]] |- ! [[Property:Has URL|Official website]]: | [[Has URL::{{{Website|}}}]] |- ! [[Property:Has Wikidata ID|Wikidata ID]]: | [[Has Wikidata ID::{{{Wikidata ID|}}}]] |- ! [[Property:Has ARCHON code|ARCHON code]]: | [[Has ARCHON code::{{{ARCHON code|}}}]] |- ! [[Property:Has main subject|Main subject]]: | {{#arraymap:{{{Main subject|Unknown}}}|;|xx|[[Has main subject::xx]]{{#set:Relates to=xx}}|
}} |} == Holdings == {{#ask: [[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]] |?Has description=Description |default=No holdings found. }} {{#if: {{{Sort by|}}} | {{DEFAULTSORT:{{{Sort by|}}} }} | }} [[Category:GLAMs]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It contains a short, human-readable description of an entity or source. This is usually displayed at the top of the page to help with disambiguation in the same way as the Wikipedia template [[Wikipedia:Template:About|about]]. It can also be displayed in query results.
Try to use as little wiki markup as possible in the description. Italics should be used where needed. Wiki links will not work.
Make the text as short as possible but do include all of an entity's names and titles as this makes it easier to search for them.
A content warning should be added to this property if a page needs one.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It defines the type of entity that a page represents.

revision.comment: what to do if Wikidata conflates settlement and parish
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an item ID at [[Wikidata:Main_Page|Wikidata]]. Only the item ID (usually starting with Q and followed by a series of digits) should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.wikidata.org/entity/$1]]
There should be an exact one to one correspondence for people and animals, but other entity types might only be an approximate match because of differences between how By The Sword Linked and Wikidata define entities or because of inconsistencies within Wikidata.
Where a Wikidata item covers a settlement and a parish at the same time, we use it only to refer to the settlement.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the earliest known date that an entity existed. This is not necessarily the same as the first date that it existed, which might be unknown. If the exact start date is known, use [[Property:Has definite start date|Has definite start date]] instead. It can be used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the latest known date that an entity existed. This is not necessarily the same as the last date that it existed, which might be unknown. If the exact end date is known, use [[Property:Has definite end date|Has definite end date]] instead. It can be used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

[[Property:Held by|Held by GLAM]]: | [[Held by::{{{In GLAM|Unknown}}}]] |- ! [[Property:Has citable reference|Citable reference]]: | [[Has citable reference::{{{Citable reference|}}}]] |- ! [[Property:Has orderable reference|Orderable reference]]: | [[Has orderable reference::{{{Orderable reference|}}}]] |- ! [[Property:Created by|Created by]]: | {{#arraymap:{{{Created by|Unknown}}}|;|xx|[[Created by::xx]]{{#set:Relates to=xx}}|
}} |- ! [[Property:Has main subject|Main subject]]: | {{#arraymap:{{{Main subject|Unknown}}}|;|xx|[[Has main subject::xx]]{{#set:Relates to=xx}}|

Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence v3.0] (OGL).}} }}{{#if:{{{Other copyright|}}}| {{#tag: ref |{{{Other copyright|}}} }} }} |} == Contents == {{#ask: [[Has parent::{{PAGENAME}}]] |mainlabel=Reference |?Has description=Description |limit=200 |default=No contents found. }} {{#if: {{{Sort by|}}} | {{DEFAULTSORT:{{{Sort by|}}} }} | }} [[Category:Collections]]

revision.comment: updated link
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows which [[GLAM]] holds a collection, manuscript text, early printed copy, or text section. This is a direct relationship between each item and its GLAM, separate from the hierarchy represented with [[Property:Has parent]]. The GLAM name qualifies the references given in [[Property:Has orderable reference]] and [[Property:Has citable reference]].

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Property:Has full reference]] to [[Property:Has citable reference]]
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. You can use it to enter the full catalogue reference (excluding the GLAM name) used to cite a manuscript, including folio numbers if any. This does not have to be a volume that can be ordered individually. For the reference used to order a document, use [[Property:Has orderable reference]]. If a collection within an archive's catalogue hierarchy does not have a corresponding catalogue reference, please put 'See lower levels' here.

revision.comment: updated link
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It shows the catalogue reference (excluding the GLAM name) that can be used to order a manuscript text or collection in the archive that holds it. If a text or collection is at a lower level than a volume that can be ordered, put the lowest level that can be ordered here. The full reference used to cite it goes in [[Property:Has citable reference]]. If the collection is at a higher level than anything that can be ordered individually, please enter 'See lower levels'.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It links to the main subjects of a source. You should only include an entity as a main subject if the source is wholly or mainly about that entity. You can include multiple subjects for the same source, but try to use as few as possible.

These are special values that can be entered in properties of page type. Instead of linking to a known entity, they indicate that the value is unknown or not applicable.
[[Category:Property values]]

revision.comment: changed definition because several other properties merged into this one
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It identifies any person or organization that created or contributed to a text. This includes:
* author of a book, article, thesis or manuscript. This includes the author of a foreword. * editor or translator of a book or article. * illustrator of a book, article or manuscript. * publisher or printer of a book published in the 17th century. We do not record semantic data for publishers of books published earlier or later than the 17th century. * person or organization that collected or created a whole [[collection]].
For people named as booksellers on the title pages of 17th-century books, use [[Property:To be sold by]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the person or organization that a manuscript document was addressed to. It is typically used for:
* letters * petitions * warrants * account books that were submitted to a committee

This is the "Manuscript text" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Manuscript text}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Manuscript texts]]. __NOTOC__ = Basic data = {{{for template|Manuscript text}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Parent: | {{{field|Part of|values from concept=Autocomplete manuscript text parents|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Parent works: | {{{field|Parent work|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Works|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Type|input type=dropdown|values from category=Manuscript text types|show on select=Will (registered copy)=>proved}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} == Archival references == {| class="formtable" |- ! Catalogue record URL: | {{{field|Catalogue record URL|input type=text}}} |- ! In GLAM: | {{{field|In GLAM|values from category=GLAMs|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Citable reference: | {{{field|Citable reference|input type=text}}} |- ! Orderable reference: | {{{field|Orderable reference|input type=text}}} |} == Child texts and sections == {{{field|Query for sections|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box to add a query for child sections or texts. You should only add the query if you know that these already exist or you expect them to exist soon. = Copyright = {| class="formtable" |- ! Copyright status of text: | {{{field|Copyright status|values from concept=Autocomplete copyright status|input type=dropdown}}} |- ! Licence conditions of text: | {{{field|Licence|values from category=Licences|input type=dropdown}}} |- ! Copyright explanation: | {{{field|Copyright explanation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |} === Copyright acknowledgements === Check the box if the following applies: {{{field|Discovery OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from [https://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/ The National Archives' Discovery catalogue]. © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence v3.0] (OGL). = Dates =
'''Will proved on''': {{{field|Proved|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} Enter the date when the original will was made in '''Earliest date of existence''' below. Leave dates covered blank.
{| class="formtable" |- ! Earliest date of existence: | {{{field|Earliest existence|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Earliest date covered: | {{{field|Earliest date covered|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Latest date covered: | {{{field|Latest date covered|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |} = Related entities = {| class="formtable" |- ! Created by: | {{{field|Created by|list|delimiter=;|values from concept=Autocomplete creators|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Signed by: | {{{field|Signed by|list|delimiter=;|values from concept=Autocomplete human agents|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Addressed to: | {{{field|Addressed to|list|delimiter=;|values from concept=Autocomplete creators|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Main subject: | {{{field|Main subject|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Mentions: | {{{field|Mentions|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |} {{{end template}}} = Published versions = You can use this free text area to link to any other versions of this manuscript that have been published online or in print. {{{section|Published versions|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Any other information = You can use this free text area to add any introductory text, such as information about the provenance or context of the manuscript, or any other relevant information that doesn't fit in other fields. {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Transcript = If copyright and licence conditions allow, you can use this free text area to add a transcript, summary or extracts of the text. Before adding text, please copy this code into the text area if it isn't already there: 
{{Intro|PUT INTRODUCTORY TEXT HERE}}
PUT TRANSCRIBED TEXT HERE
{{End of transcript}}
And replace 'PUT INTRODUCTORY TEXT HERE' with any introductory text that is needed. For more help, see [[Help:Transcription conventions#Introductory text]] {{{section|Transcript|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the earliest date covered by a source. This can be before the source itself was created. For example, memoirs and account books can refer to periods before they were written.
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the latest date covered by a source. This can be before the source itself was created. For example, memoirs and account books can refer to periods before they were written.
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

{{#default_form:Manuscript text}} All pages in this category are manuscript texts but they can be [[Property:is instance of|instances of]] many different types.
[[Category:Default form categories]]

revision.text: All text and data (apart from embedded maps from OpenStreetMap) are available under $1 licence. Where attribution is required for data reused from other sources, this will be stated on the relevant pages.

revision.comment: do not take as legal advice
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the current copyright status of the original text of a source as far as we can tell, but should not be taken as legal advice. Allowed values are listed in [[:Category:Copyright status]].

{{#default_form:Copyright status}} It lists allowed values of [[Property:Has copyright status]].
[[Category:Default form categories]]

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Category:Manuscript text type definitions]] to [[Category:Manuscript text types]] without leaving a redirect: Text replacement - "type definitions" to "types"
revision.text:
Pages in this category define types of manuscript texts. This is used in the 'Type' field in [[Form:Manuscript text]] which feeds the value to [[Property:Is instance of]]. Pages should be included in this category to make them available in the dropdown list in the form.
[[Category:Property values]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows which manuscript or printed text a section ultimately belongs to. This is not always the same as the value of [[Property:Has parent]]. The value of '''is section of''' should never be another section, only a manuscript text or printed copy.

This is the "Manuscript text section" template. It is used by [[Form:Manuscript text section]] and should not be used separately. Edit the page to see the template text. __NOEDITSECTION__[[Has parent::{{{Part of|Unknown}}}]] > '''{{PAGENAME}}''' [[has description::{{{Description|No description entered.}}}]] __TOC__ == Basic data == This is a section of the text [[Is section of::{{{Ancestor text|{{{Part of|Unknown}}}}}}]]. See that text for further details. {| class="swordinfotable" |- ! [[Property:Is instance of|Instance of]]: | [[Is instance of::Manuscript text section]] |- ! [[Property:Has citable reference|Citable reference]]: | [[Has citable reference::{{{Citable reference|}}}]] |- ! [[Property:Has main subject|Main subject]]: | {{#arraymap:{{{Main subject|Unknown}}}|;|xx|[[Has main subject::xx]]{{#set:Relates to=xx}}|
}} |- ! [[Property:Mentions|Mentions]]: | {{#arraymap:{{{Mentions|Unknown}}}|;|xx|[[Mentions::xx]]{{#set:Relates to=xx}}|
}} |- ! [[Property:Covers period from|Covers period from]]: | {{#set:Covers period from={{{Earliest date covered| }}} }}{{#tag: date|| when = {{{Earliest date covered| }}} }} |- ! You should only add the query if you know that child sections exist or expect them to exist soon. {{{end template}}} = Any other information = You can use this free text area to add any introductory text, such as information about the provenance or context of the manuscript, or any other relevant information that doesn't fit in other fields. {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Transcript = If copyright and licence conditions allow, you can use this free text area to add a transcript, summary or extracts of the text. PUT TRANSCRIBED TEXT HERE

revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] to show which unit or other entity is the subordinate in the relationship.
The value of this property is usually set automatically by a template so it doesn't have to be entered.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that one entity is a parent of another. The exact meaning depends on the context.
Note that it never represents:
* a relationship between two people as this is outside the scope of this project. * a relationship between copies, editions and works. For this, use [[Property:Is version of]] instead.
== Command relationships ==
It is used by subobjects in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] to show which unit or other entity is the parent in the relationship. Depending on the relationship type, this may be an ancestor rather than an immediate parent.
Where the child unit is an address and [[Property:Has role|relationship type]] is [[military occupation]], the parent should have two values: one should be an [[Allegiance faction]], and the other the specific unit which occupied the place. This is to make it easier to generate maps of territory controlled by factions.
== Collections, manuscript texts, and printed copies ==
It shows a source's immediate parent in the hierarchy of the archive that holds it.
* the parent of a collection can be another collection or a GLAM * the parent of a manuscript text can be another manuscript text, a collection, or sometimes a GLAM * the parent of an early printed copy can be a collection or a GLAM * the parent of a text section is the manuscript text or printed copy that it's part of, or another section if the text has a more complicated structure
== Event ==
It shows that one event was part of another, such as:
* an assault or sally that was part of a siege. * a battle or skirmish that was part of a bigger raid. For example, the battle of Chalgrove was part of the raid on Chinnor but was a distinct part of it that needs a page in its own right. * a battle or capture of a fort that was part of a bigger series of battles, such as the individual parts of the battles of Lostwithiel. * a meeting that happened on one day but was part of a longer session

revision.comment: removed default form
revision.text:
This category lists roles that can be used in personnel relationships, and classes that can be used to group roles together. These are ranks or positions that people could hold in organizations. They are used as values by [[Form:Agent]] and [[Template:Personnel subobject]].
[[Category:Property values]]

Sub-categories of this category contain lists of pages that are used as values for certain semantic properties where the property is of type Page and the values are not specific individual entities such as people. These lists are used to populate autocomplete suggestions or dropdown lists in forms. The pages define what the term means in human readable terms and links to a Wikidata ID if available.
Most subcategories are for type definitions used as values of [[Property:Is instance of]] or role definitions used as values or [[Property:Has role]].
[[Category:Categories]]

revision.comment: category
revision.text:
Sub-categories of this category are associated with a default form. Each one contains all instances of pages created and edited with its default form.
[[Category:Categories]]

revision.comment: expanded description
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::Geographic coordinates]]. It records a geographic point that roughly corresponds to the location of an Address or [[combat event]].
Coordinates are assumed to use the WGS84 system, which is the system for geographic coordinates used by Google Maps, Geonames, Open Street Map, Wikidata and many others but is different from the Ordnance Survey National Grid. ETRS89 geodetic coordinates are near enough that they can be entered here but the software will treat them as WGS84 afterwards.
Latitude comes first, and longitude second, separated by a comma. You can enter the values as decimal degrees or as degrees, minutes and seconds. They are automatically displayed on the page as degrees, minutes and seconds.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an ID at [http://www.geonames.org/ Geonames]. This is used in addition to Wikidata IDs because Geonames tends to make a more rigorous distinction between populated places and administrative units, whereas Wikidata sometimes conflates both into one entity which has two Geonames IDs. You should only enter the ID number here, not the full URL, or the html page appended to the ID number. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.geonames.org/$1/]]

This is the "Area" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Area}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Areas]]. __NOTOC__ = Basic data = {{{for template|Area}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Type|input type=combobox|values from category=Area types}}} |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Vision of Britain ID: | {{{field|Vision of Britain ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Start date: | {{{field|Earliest date type|input type=dropdown|values=earliest known date,definite start date|default=earliest known date}}} {{{field|Earliest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! End date: | {{{field|Latest date type|input type=dropdown|values=latest known date,definite end date|default=latest known date}}} {{{field|Latest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources for end date: | {{{field|Latest date ref|input type=textarea|rows=3|cols=45}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} Sort key should be left blank unless page name contains accented characters, in which case sort key should be page name but with accented characters replaced by non-accented ASCII characters. = Copyright = Check the box if any of the following apply: {{{field|NCA OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains National Character Area data © Natural England copyright. Contains Ordnance Survey data © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). {{{field|NLCA OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains Natural Resources Wales information © Natural Resources Wales and Database Right. Contains Ordnance Survey Data. Ordnance Survey Licence number 100019741. Crown Copyright and Database Right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). Enter any other copyright acknowledgements in this box: {{{field|Other copyright|input type=textarea|rows=20}}} = Parent units = {{{field|Parent units|holds template}}} =Queries= ==Subordinates== {{{field|Override subord query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-subord-query}}} A standard query for linked subordinates will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Subord query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}}
==Personnel== {{{field|Override pers query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-pers-query}}} A standard query for linked personnel will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Pers query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}}
==Sources== {{{field|Override source query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-source-query}}} A standard query for sources will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Source query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}} For reference, the code for the standard query is shown below. You can copy this into the text area above and adapt it if you need to. 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 20
| default = No linked sources found.
}}

Type: | {{{field|Relationship type|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Command relationship types|list|delimiter=;|property=Has role|size=45}}} |- ! From: | {{{field|Earliest date type|input type=dropdown|values=earliest known date,definite start date|default=earliest known date}}}{{{field|Earliest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! To: | {{{field|Latest date type|input type=dropdown|values=latest known date,definite end date|default=latest known date}}}{{{field|Latest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources: | {{{field|Command ref|input type=textarea|rows=5|cols=45|placeholder=You can use wiki markup to create links here.}}} |} {{{end template}}} =Links to sources= You can use the text area below to create manual links to sources. These can be: * external links to pages on other websites. * internal links to pages on this wiki if semantic links that will show up in a query aren't appropriate. For example, if this entity isn't the main subject of a book and you need to cite a page number here. {{{section|Links to sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Any other info = {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a unit ID at [http://www.visionofbritain.org.uk/ Vision of Britain]. Only the ID number should be entered in this property. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.visionofbritain.org.uk/unit/$1]]

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Category:Area type definitions]] to [[Category:Area types]] without leaving a redirect: Text replacement - "type definitions" to "types"
revision.text:
These pages define entity types for pages created and edited using [[Form:Area]]. An area usually represents a civil or ecclesiastical administrative unit. They have boundaries which can change over time but cannot change position from day to day.
[[Category:Property values]]

revision.comment: links broken
revision.text:
(Links created by this property are broken because the Ordnance Survey has withdrawn its old linked data service.)
This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an ID from Ordnance Survey OpenNames. This is used for settlements in Great Britain in addition to other identifiers because OS data has the most complete and reliable coverage. It should be left blank for settlements outside Great Britain.
[[External formatter uri::http://data.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/id/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects that represent a temporary location in [[Template:Location subobject]]. It refers to the unit or agent whose location is represented. The value is always set automatically by the template.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the approximate location of an entity in relation to an address. 'Located in or near' means that the location is deliberately kept vague because 17th-century sources don't always allow us to be more specific. It is used by:
* Events ([[Template:Event]]) * Addresses ([[Template:Address]]) if the address is a [[building]], [[street], or [[bridge]], but not if it is a [[settlement]]. * Location subobjects ([[Template:Location subobject]]) which link units or agents to their locations on known dates

[[Category:Default form categories]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is a parent property used to query for sources that are related to an entity in any way. It is not displayed directly in entity pages or added directly in forms. Instead it is silently added by templates, with the same values that are used in any of these properties:
* [[Property:Addressed to]] * [[Property:Created by]] * [[Property:Has main subject]] * [[Property:Mentions]] * [[Property:Possibly mentions]] * [[Property:Signed by]] * [[Property:To be sold at]] * [[Property:To be sold by]]
This creates a hierarchy similar to subproperties but makes it easier to display property values in query results.

revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used when an entity mentioned in a source can't be positively identified but there are one or more possibilities.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that a source mentions an entity which has been positively identified, but does not specify any particular role in the document, such as author or addressee.

To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Address}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Addresses]]. __NOTOC__ = Basic data = {{{for template|Address}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Could be same as: | {{{field|Possibly same as|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Addresses}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Type|input type=dropdown|values from category=Address types}}} |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Geonames ID: | {{{field|Geonames ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Ordnance Survey ID: | {{{field|Ordnance Survey ID|input type=text}}} |- ! MoEML ID: | {{{field|MoEML ID|input type=text}}} |- ! In or near: | {{{field|Address|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Addresses|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! WGS84 Coordinates: | [[#Coordinates|Use map below]] |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} Sort key should be left blank unless page name contains accented characters, in which case sort key should be page name but with accented characters replaced by non-accented ASCII characters. == Coordinates == You can use the map below to add or change the coordinates for this place. Just zoom the map in to the right area and double click on the map. The coordinates of the point where you double click will be recorded in the box. You can also manually edit the coordinates in the box or paste in coordinates from somewhere else. {{{field|Coordinates|input type=leaflet|starting bounds=48.66291, -11.91943;61.14394, 0.73682}}} = Copyright = Acknowledgements for Geonames and Ordnance Survey will be added automatically if the page has IDs from any of those sources. Check the boxes for any of the following that apply: {{{field|NRS OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from National Records of Scotland © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). {{{field|WLC OGL|input type=checkbox}}} This page contains data from the Welsh Language Commissioner (Comisiynydd y Gymraeg) © Crown copyright and database right. Free to use under the [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). Enter any other copyright acknowledgements in this box: {{{field|Other copyright|input type=textarea|rows=20}}} = Parent units = {{{field|Parent units|holds template}}} =Queries= ==Personnel== {{{field|Override pers query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-pers-query}}} A standard query for linked personnel will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Pers query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}}
==Subordinates== {{{field|Override subord query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-subord-query}}} A standard query for subordinate addresses linked to this address will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Subord query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}}
==Sources== {{{field|Override source query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-source-query}}} A standard query for sources will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Source query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}} For reference, the code for the standard query is shown below. You can copy this into the text area above and adapt it if you need to. 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 20
| default = No linked sources found.
}}
{{{end template}}} {{{for template|Command relationship subobject|embed in field=Address[Parent units]|multiple|add button text=Add parent}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Parent: | {{{field|Parent unit|input type=tokens|values from concept=Autocomplete parent organizations|property=Has parent|list|delimiter=;|size=45}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Relationship type|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Command relationship types|list|delimiter=;|property=Has role|size=45}}} |- ! From: | {{{field|Earliest date type|input type=dropdown|values=earliest known date,definite start date|default=earliest known date}}}{{{field|Earliest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! To: | {{{field|Latest date type|input type=dropdown|values=latest known date,definite end date|default=latest known date}}}{{{field|Latest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources: | {{{field|Command ref|input type=textarea|rows=5|cols=45|placeholder=You can use wiki markup to create links here.}}} |} {{{end template}}} =Links to sources= You can use the text area below to create manual links to sources. These can be: * external links to pages on other websites. * internal links to pages on this wiki if semantic links that will show up in a query aren't appropriate. For example, if this entity isn't the main subject of a book and you need to cite a page number here. {{{section|Links to sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Any other info = {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

{{#default_form:Address}}
[[Category:Default form categories]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents an International Standard Book Number. It can accept either ISBN 10 or ISBN 13 numbers, but it should only have one value. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:BookSources/$1]]
This links to a special page at Wikidata where you can find links to search for the book in library catalogues and online booksellers.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used to link:
* journal articles to the journal they were published in * serial volumes to the serial they were published in * chapters to the edited collection they were published in

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents a Digital Object Identifier, which is typically used to refer to a journal article or thesis. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://doi.org/$1]]
The DOI for the version of record should only be used for that version. A self-archived article either has its own DOI or no DOI.

revision.comment: Gavin moved page [[Property:Has publication year]] to [[Property:Published in year]]
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the year of publication of a [[book format]] as stated on the title page or in a catalogue record. It is not stored as a date and does not make any claims about which calendar is used.
This property can have multiple values separated by semi-colons if an edition consists of multiple volumes that were published in different years.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the issue number of the journal issue that an [[article]] was published in. For volume number, use [[Property:Has volume number]]. An article might have both an issue and volume number, or only one or the other, depending on how the journal is numbered.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]].
For [[article]]s published in a journal, it represents the volume number of the journal volume that an article was published in. For issue number, use [[Property:Has issue number]]. An article might have both an issue and volume number, or only one or the other, depending on how the journal is numbered. A volume typically covers one year, but this could vary. A journal article should usually have only one volume number.
For a [[modern edition]] that is part of a series, this property represents the volume number within the series. It is represented at the level of editions, not formats. If the edition has multiple volumes, the property can have multiple values separated by semi-colons, each one giving the number of a volume. For example, I.G. Philip's edition of ''The Journal of Sir Samuel Luke'' published by Oxfordshire Record Society, would have these values:
29;31;33
We do not record volume numbers for a book that has more than one volume but is not part of a series (for example, Warburton's ''Memoirs of Prince Rupert and the Cavaliers''). This information can usually be found in external resources linked to by external identifiers. In some cases, volumes of a book may need to be represented as different editions or formats.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It represents the full title of an [[early edition]], [[modern edition]], [[article]] or [[thesis]]. It is '''not''' split into main title and subtitle.

revision.comment: how to handle Roman numerals
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the page number on which an [[article]] starts. If the page number in the original text is a Roman numeral, leave this blank as it can only take Arabic numerals. Page numbers in Roman numerals can still be entered in the text of [[Property:Has description]].

revision.comment: how to handle Roman numerals
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the page number on which an [[article]] ends. If the page number in the original text is a Roman numeral, leave this blank as it can only take Arabic numerals. Page numbers in Roman numerals can still be entered in the text of [[Property:Has description]].

revision.comment: Created page with "{{#default_form:Thesis}} [[Category:Default form categories]]"
revision.text:
{{#default_form:Thesis}}
[[Category:Default form categories]]
This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the year in which a [[thesis]] was complete.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the bookseller who was to sell an early edition of a book or serial. A person should only be added to this property if they are named on the title page of the edition in question, otherwise the value should be [[None]]. This property is only used for editions published in the mid-17th century.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the address where an early edition of a book or serial was to be sold. An address should only be added to this property if it is given on the title page of the edition in question, otherwise the value should be [[None]]. This property is only used for editions published in the mid-17th century.

revision.comment: links broken
revision.text:
(Links created by this property are currently broken because of the cyber attack on the British Library in October 2023.)
This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a citation number at the [http://ESTC.bl.uk/ English Short Title Catalogue]. Only the value of ESTC Citation No. ('''not''' ESTC, System No.) should be entered. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://ESTC.bl.uk/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::URL]]. It is used for:
* [[article]] if the official version of record is available online and has a URL but not a DOI. * [[book format]] to link to a page for this edition at the publisher's website, where you may be able to buy a copy. It should '''not''' be used to link to any other retailer. * [[collection]] and [[Form:manuscript text|manuscript text]] to link to an official catalogue record in the online catalogue of the [[GLAM]] that holds it. * [[thesis]] to link to an official catalogue record in the online library catalogue or institutional repository of the university at which it was completed. * [[GLAM]] and [[serial publication]] to link to its official website. * [[Unit]]: ** Regiments: BCW Project Regimental Wiki page. These links are currently broken because the Regimental Wiki is unavailable but [http://theminiaturespage.com/boards/msg.mv?id=573695 discussion at The Miniatures Page forum] suggests it will come back. ** Livery companies: the company's official website.
