This is the "Event" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Event}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Events]]. __NOTOC__ {{{for template|Event}}} = Basic data = == Basic data == {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Type|input type=dropdown|values from category=Event types}}} |- ! Location: | {{{field|Location|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Addresses|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Coordinates: | [[#Coordinates|Use map below]] (only for combat events) |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} Sort key should be left blank unless page name contains accented characters, in which case sort key should be page name but with accented characters replaced by non-accented ASCII characters. == Dates == This event happened on: {{{field|Days|values=one day,multiple days|input type=dropdown|show on select=one day=>one-day;multiple days=>mult-days}}}
Enter the date of this event below {| class="formtable" |- ! Date: | {{{field|Single date|input type=text|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL|size=13|maxlength=13}}} |}
Enter the start and end date below, and use the dropdown lists to select whether the date is definite or the earliest/latest known: {| class="formtable" |- | {{{field|Start date type|input type=dropdown|values=definite start date,earliest known date|default=definite start date}}} | {{{field|Start date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- | {{{field|End date type|input type=dropdown|values=definite end date,latest known date|default=definite end date}}} | {{{field|End date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |}
== Result == If this was a combat event which was wholly the capture, or attempted capture, of a building or settlement, please enter the result here. Otherwise leave blank. {{{field|Result|input type=dropdown|values=Captured,Held}}} == Related events == {| class="formtable" |- ! Parent event: | {{{field|Parent|values from concept=Autocomplete parent events|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |} {{{field|Query for child events|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box to add a query for events that were part of this event. You should only add the query if you know that this event has child events. == Coordinates == You can use the map below to add or change the coordinates for this event if it is a combat event (leave blank for other types of event). Just zoom the map in to the right area and double click on the map. The coordinates of the point where you double click will be recorded in the box. (You can't manually edit the coordinates in the box or paste in coordinates from somewhere else because this feature isn't working properly.) {{{field|Coordinates|input type=leaflet|starting bounds=48.66291, -11.91943;61.14394, 0.73682}}} =Query for sources= {{{field|Override query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-query}}} A standard query for sources will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Source query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}} For reference, the code for the standard query is shown below. You can copy this into the text area above and adapt it if you need to. 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 20
| default = No linked sources found.
}}
{{{end template}}} =Links to sources= You can use the text area below to create manual links to sources. These can be: * external links to pages on other websites. * internal links to pages on this wiki if semantic links that will show up in a query aren't appropriate. For example, if this entity isn't the main subject of a book and you need to cite a page number here. {{{section|Links to sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} =Any other info= {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

revision.comment: changed licence to CC-BY-SA
revision.text:
__TOC__
== Using material from this site ==
All text and semantic data on this site (apart from embedded maps, see below) is made available under a [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/ Creative Commons Attribution Share Alike licence] (CC-BY-SA). This means that you are free to copy, use, adapt, and republish any text or data for any purpose, including commercial use, provided that you acknowledge this site as the source and that if you publish a derivative work, it must be released under exactly the same licence. A link to this site will be sufficient acknowledgement. If the material comes from only one page, it's best to link directly to that page. If it comes from more than one page, a link to the main page of the site will be enough.
Note that some material here is reused from other sources and may be under its own Creative Commons licence or [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). In these cases, the other copyright holders should be acknowledged as well as this site. This applies to pages that have a statement acknowledging copyright, and to pages that represent a manuscript text that has its own copyright and licence conditions stated as part of its metadata.
Because this site's licence now has a Share Alike condition, you must not change the licence conditions of derivative works.
=== Maps ===
Embedded maps are from [https://www.openstreetmap.org/ OpenStreetMap]. They have their own copyright and licence conditions which you can find by clicking the link in the bottom right corner of each map.
== Adding material to this site ==
In order to be published on this site, text or data must be:
* '''either''' released under a valid licence that is compatible with CC-BY-SA. Valid means that it must be licensed by someone who has the legal right to do so. Compatible usually means CC0, CC-BY, CC-BY-SA or OGL. * '''or''' free from all possible restrictions. This includes contracts and terms of use as well as intellectual property rights. To meet this condition: ** copyright and database right must have expired or never subsisted in the first place. This includes new copyrights in a derivative work that includes editorial changes to a work that is out of copyright in its original version. ** there must not be any claims to own intellectual property in the material, even if these claims are potentially dubious or actually being disputed. We prefer to be cautious in these cases in order to avoid conflict. ** the material must not be copied from an electronic resource whose terms of use restrict reuse, even if the material itself is out of copyright. ** there must not be any other contract restricting reuse of the material. This includes agreements with archives for permission to copy physical documents from their holdings. ** absence of a licence or copyright statement '''does not''' imply that a work is free of restrictions.
== Linking to other sites ==
We allow external links to any other sites that publish material legally, even if their conditions do not allow the material to be republished here. If a site's terms of use ban incoming links or say that incoming links require permission, we won't usually link to them even though such terms are not likely to be legally enforceable.
We do not allow links to sites that publish material illegally. This especially means sites such as Sci-Hub, whose main purpose is to share infringing copies of articles. It also includes Academia.edu because some self-archived articles there may breach the authors' publishing contracts and infringe rights that have been exclusively licensed to the publisher. [https://hcommons.org/ Humanities Commons] is a much better place to self-archive articles because it's non-commercial, allows you to reserve all rights, and gives the self-archived version its own DOI.
The Internet Archive is treated on a case by case basis: if a copy published there infringes copyright according to UK law, it must not be linked to from here, but this does not affect links to other Internet Archive material that is out of copyright. (This principle can't be applied to Academia.edu because we can't know the terms of each relevant publishing contract.)
== Jurisdiction ==
This site is hosted in the UK and is governed by UK copyright law. Our policies are based on UK copyright law. Accessing this site or reusing material from it may (or may not) infringe copyright in other jurisdictions.

This website is provided as is with no warranties. Use of this website is at your own risk.
There is no warranty that any information on this site, or on external sites that it links to, is complete, accurate or fit for any particular purpose. Historical knowledge often changes and is often uncertain or disputed. This website has not been formally peer reviewed. You should always use your own judgement when assessing factual claims.
There is no warranty that any material on this website, or on external sites that it links to, is free from the risk of infringement of intellectual property rights. Copyright law is complicated and easily misunderstood, and varies between jurisdictions. If you have any doubts, you should seek legal advice.
There is no warranty that this website will be available at any particular time, or that the software will function correctly.
External websites that this website links to are not guaranteed to meet this project's moral or intellectual standards. Websites that we cannot avoid linking to but cannot control may contain problems such as deadnaming or misgendering of trans people, anti-abortion propaganda, or links to Holocaust denials.
These disclaimers are similar to those used by many respectable sources. See [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia:Non-Wikipedia disclaimers|Wikipedia:Non-Wikipedia disclaimers]] for more examples.

This is the "Type definition" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. This form is used to create and edit pages that define an entity type or class. {{#forminput:form=Type definition}} All pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Type definitions]]. __NOTOC__ = Basic data = {{{for template|Type definition}}} Select the form used to edit instances of this type: {{{field|Instance form|input type=dropdown|values=Agent,Address,Area,Collection,Event,Manuscript text,Material object,Unit|show on select=Address=>has-pers;Area=>has-pers;Unit=>has-pers}}} Leave blank if this is a higher class that could cover more than one form, or if the relevant form only ever has one type (Article, Author, Copyright status, Licence, Modern edition, Early edition, GLAM, Serial publication, Thesis or Work). {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Subclass of: | {{{field|Subclass of|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Type definitions|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |} = Queries = == Subclasses == Select whether to query for subclasses of this class: {{{field|Override subclass query|input type=dropdown|default=Standard|values=Standard,None,Custom|show on select=Custom=>new-subclass-query}}}
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Subclass query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}} For reference, the code for the standard query is shown below. You can copy this into the text area above and adapt it if you need to. 
{{#ask:
[[Is subclass of::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| default=No subclasses found.
}}
== Instances == Select whether to query for instances of this class: {{{field|Override instance query|input type=dropdown|default=<2000|values=None,<2000,>2000}}} You can use this text area to add extra explanations or links, for example linking to a category: {{{field|Instance query|input type=textarea|rows=10}}}
== Personnel roles == Query for personnel roles. {{{field|Override pers query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-pers-query}}} A standard query for personnel roles that can be used with this type will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Pers query|input type=textarea|rows=10}}}
== Query for sources == {{{field|Override source query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-source-query}}} A standard query for sources will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Source query|input type=textarea|rows=10}}} For reference, the code for the standard query is shown below. You can copy this into the text area above and adapt it if you need to. 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 20
| default = No linked sources found.
}}
{{{end template}}} =Free text= ==Links to sources== You can use the text area below to create manual links to sources. These can be: * external links to pages on other websites. * internal links to pages on this wiki if semantic links that will show up in a query aren't appropriate. For example, if this type isn't the main subject of a book and you need to cite a page number here. {{{section|Links to sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} == Any other information == You can use this text area to write a human-readable definition of this type definition: {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

This page gives an overview of the progress of this project.
[[:Category:Default form categories]] lists subcategories for each basic entity type and shows the total number of pages of each type.
== Data structures ==
Data structures are not expected to change much in future.
For the current state of the data structures, see:
* [[Help:Create a page]] for a brief overview of the different types. * [[Help:Data structures]] for a more detailed look at the properties and how they're used for each type. * [[Special:Properties]] for a list of all semantic properties. Each property page gives more details of what it means and how it's used. * [[:Category:Type definitions]] for values that can be used for [[Property:Is instance of]]. More need to be added, especially for military units. * [[:Category:Property values]] for other property values that are not instances or classes of entities. Many more need to be added, especially military ranks.
== Places and administrative areas ==
* [[:Category:Addresses]] lists all settlements, buildings, streets, islands, bridges and land that currently have pages. This is now nearly 19,000 pages. * [[:Category:Areas]] lists all administrative areas such as counties. * we have pages for all [[Cathedral]]s in England and Wales. * you can drill down from [[Church of England]] to find all provinces, dioceses, archdeaconries and rural deaneries in England and Wales. We only have parishes for London, Westminster and Southwark. There are pages for some but not all peculiar jurisdictions.
=== Scotland ===
[[Scotland]] represents the country and gives links to subordinates.
* [[:Category:Counties of Scotland by Gaelic name]] lists all shires of Scotland by their Gaelic names. * we have pages for around 6,000 populated places, mostly derived from Ordnance Survey data. You can find individual places using the search box, or follow the links from county pages to query for all settlements in that county. * 165 pages for Scottish islands: ** [[Locations:Map of Scottish islands]]
=== England ===
[[England]] represents the country and gives links to subordinates.
We now have a page for every:
* [[county at large]] and [[county of itself]] * [[National Character Area (England)]]. * [[shrievalty]]. These are jurisdictions of [[sheriff]]s and are always represented separately from the county or city they are named after. * parliamentary constituency.
We now have over 12,000 [[settlement]]s in England. At least 1,000 are still missing. You can find an individual settlement using the search box, or follow the links from county pages to query for all settlements in that county.
==== London ====
London, Westminster and Southwark now have:
* probably all parishes and churches. * all wards of the [[London city, England#Subordinates|City of London]]. * more than 500 other {{#ask: [[Category:Addresses]] [[Located in or near::London, England]] | ?Has description=Description | limit = 0 | searchlabel = London streets and buildings }}, many of them linked to [[Property:Has MoEML ID|Map of Early Modern London IDs]].
=== Wales ===
[[Wales]] represents the country and gives links to subordinates.
We now have a page for every:
* county: ** [[:Category:Counties of Wales by Welsh name]] lists all shires and probably all corporate counties by Welsh names. * [[National Landscape Character Area (Wales)]]. * [[shrievalty]]. These are jurisdictions of [[sheriff]]s and are always represented separately from the county or city they are named after.
So far we only have a few example populated places, mostly near battlefields.
== People and animals ==
* [[:Category:Authors]] includes over 1,700 people who wrote sources relevant to the British Civil Wars but were not alive at the time. * [[:Category:Agents]] lists people and animals who were alive during the British Civil Wars. Includes: ** about 750 regicides and MPs who never had peerages ** all [[:Category:Saddlers (trading as)|saddlers]] and [[:Category:Harness makers (trading as)|harness makers]] who supplied the [[New Model Army]] in 1645-46 ** a small selection of other people ** [[Grey horse (George Willingham's)|one horse]].
== Units ==
* [[:Category:Units]] lists all organizations that we class as units. This can include military units, ships, committees, livery companies, households. * [[New Model Army#Tactical_subordinates]] lists all original regiments of the New Model Army formed in 1645. * Short Parliament: ** [[House of Lords, Short Parliament]] ** [[House of Commons, Short Parliament]]
== Events ==
* [[:Category:Events]] lists all events. * a selection of battles and sieges in Great Britain, including every battle that is covered by the Battlefields Trust: ** [[Events:Map of combat events|Map of combat events]] * every day of the Short Parliament: ** [[Events:House of Lords, Short Parliament|House of Lords]] ** [[Events:House of Commons, Short Parliament|House of Commons]]
== Sources ==
* [[:Category:GLAMs]] lists archives and libraries that hold manuscripts or early printed copies. Only three examples for now.
=== Manuscripts ===
* [[:Category:Collections]] lists collections within GLAMs. For now these are only manuscript collections but they will later include early printed books. * [[:Category:Manuscript texts]] lists manuscripts that still exist and whose location and catalogue reference is known. * [[:Category:Lost manuscript texts]] lists manuscripts that no longer exist, or whose location is unknown, or that do not have catalogue references.
[[TNA, SP 28]] (aka Commonwealth Exchequer Papers) has a page for every piece but not yet for every item. Pay warrants from 1642 to 1648 have extra levels that are not represented in TNA's catalogue but are not yet catalogued at folio level. All known [[Buckinghamshire loss account]]s now have a page and are linked to the settlements they refer to.
=== Books ===
* all books that have pages here are listed in [[:Category:Early editions]] and [[:Category:Modern editions]]. * [[Century of the Soldier (Helion)#Contents]] lists all books in this series that are about the British Civil Wars and that were published up to December 2023. Forthcoming titles are not yet included. * [[Making of the English Landscape#Contents]] lists all books in this series.
=== Articles and chapters ===
* [[:Category:Articles]] lists journal articles and chapters in edited collections. * [[:Category:Serial publications]] lists journals and series of monographs. Only a small selection so far. * The following journals have linked contents for all articles relevant to the British Civil Wars up to the end of 2023: ** [[Journal of the Society for Army Historical Research]] ** [[Midland History]]
=== Theses ===
* [[:Category:Theses]] lists unpublished theses and dissertations. We now have more than 600, mostly from EThOS.

This is the "Unit events page" form. Pages that use this form should only be created from red links on Unit pages, or using the form input on existing pages that use this form. {{{for template|Unit events page}}} Select page type: {{{field|Page type|values=Map,Subpages,Table|input type=dropdown|show on select=Map=>locmap;Subpages=>locsubpages;Table=>loctable}}}
Display a map of events. This can be limited to one type of event and/or a range of dates using the boxes below. Leave all boxes blank to show all events. {{{field|Map event type|values=Combat event,Meeting|input type=dropdown}}} {{{field|From|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} {{{field|To|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}}
A list of subpages will be displayed automatically when you save the page. Nothing needs to be entered here. To create a new subpage, use the input on the saved page.
You can add events to this page here. {{{field|Unit events|holds template}}}
{{{end template}}} {{{for template|Unit event subobject|embed in field=Unit events page[Unit events]|multiple|add button text=Add event}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Event: |{{{field|Event|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Events|property=Has event|size=45}}} |- ! revision.comment: expanded description
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the date when a will was proved by a probate court. It is only used by instances of [[will (registered copy)]] and not by any other type of manuscript text. The date of probate is not assumed to be the earliest date when the registered copy existed.

{{#default_form:Subject heading}} These pages represent general themes that are not specific entities, or entities of types that are not otherwise represented. They can be used as values of [[Property:Has main subject]].
[[Category:Default form categories]]

This is the "Subject heading" template. It is only used by [[Form:Subject heading]] and should not be used separately. Edit the page to see the template text. __NOEDITSECTION__[[Has description::{{{Description|No description entered}}}]] ''{{{Disambiguation| }}}'' __TOC__ == Basic data == {| class="swordinfotable" |- ! [[Property:Is subclass of|Subclass of]]: | {{#arraymap:{{{Subclass of|Unknown}}}|;|x|[[Is subclass of::x]]|
}} |- ! [[Property:Has Wikidata ID|Wikidata ID]]: | [[Has Wikidata ID::{{{Wikidata ID|}}}]] |} == Subclasses == {{#ask: [[Is subclass of::{{PAGENAME}}]] |?Has description=Description |default=No subclasses found. }} == Query for sources == {{{Query|{{#ask: [[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]] |?Has description=Description |default=No linked sources found. }} }}} {{#if: {{{Sort by|}}} | {{DEFAULTSORT:{{{Sort by|}}} }} | }} [[Category:Subject headings]]

<noinclude>
This is the "Subject heading" form.
To create a page with this form, enter the page name below;
if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page.


{{#forminput:form=Subject heading}}

Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Subject headings]].
</noinclude><includeonly>
__NOTOC__
=Basic data=

{| class="formtable"
|-
! Description: 
| {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45|placeholder=Brief description of this subject.}}}
|-
! Disambiguation text: 
| {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea|cols=45}}}
|-
! Subclass of: 
| {{{field|Subclass of|list|delimiter=;|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|values from category=Subject headings}}}
|-
! Wikidata ID: 
| {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}}
|-
! Sort key: 
| {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}}
|}

=Query for sources=

You can use this box to change the standard query for linked sources. Leave it blank to keep the standard query.

{{{field|Query|input type=textarea|cols=45}}}

{{{end template}}}

=Free text=

==Links to sources==

You can use this box to add links to external websites that are relevant to this subject.

{{{section|Links to sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}}

==Any other information==

revision.comment: category
revision.text:
You can use semantic queries to search the data on this site.
* [[Special:Ask]] allows you to write your own queries using Semantic Mediawiki's own query language. For more help, see: ** [https://www.semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Semantic_search Semantic Mediawiki help page: Semantic search], which gives an introduction and examples. ** [[Help:Data structures]], which documents the properties we use at this site. * [[Special:RunQuery/Search_events_by_date|Search events by date]] provides a simple form that lets you search for events that happened within a specified date range. * [[Events:Map of combat events|Map of combat events]] is a ready-made query that shows each [[combat event]] on a map, if it has a page on this site and the page includes coordinates. * [[Locations:Map of cathedrals|Map of cathedrals]] is a ready-made query that shows every instance of [[cathedral]] on a map, if it has coordinates. * [[Special:RunQuery/Journals by month of issue|Journals by month of issue]] provides a simple form that lets you search for journals that are expected to publish new issues in the selected month.
Most pages also have semantic queries built into them to display links to other pages.
[[Category:Help pages]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It shows the months when new issues of a [[serial publication]] are usually published. If the series is not expected to be published in future, or it is a book series that does not have issues, the value should be 'None'.
The allowed values for this property are: * [[Allows value::Jan]] * [[Allows value::Feb]] * [[Allows value::Mar]] * [[Allows value::Apr]] * [[Allows value::May]] * [[Allows value::Jun]] * [[Allows value::Jul]] * [[Allows value::Aug]] * [[Allows value::Sep]] * [[Allows value::Oct]] * [[Allows value::Nov]] * [[Allows value::Dec]] * [[Allows value::None]] * [[Allows value::Unknown]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It shows when the contents of a [[serial publication]] were last updated in this wiki, or when a new issue was checked and no relevant articles were found. NOT when the serial itself was last published.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It records the spelling that a historical person used when they wrote their own name. If the original spelling is recorded using this property, there is less need for the page name to match the spelling, but there should at least be a redirect for the original spelling.
Original spelling should be retained including literal u, v, i, j, or ff. This is different from our standard [[transcription conventions]] for transcripts of documents. As in our standard conventions, original capitalization should be retained.
The default value is 'Unknown', which means it is not yet known whether a person wrote their own name or how they spelt it.
If the person only ever signed with a title during this period, the title should be entered instead of their actualy name. For example, 'Essex' for [[Devereux, Robert (3rd Earl of Essex)]].
If a person only ever signed with initials, the initials should be entered here and not expanded to their full name.
In some special cases, the values should be:
* 'X' if the person is only known to have signed with a cross. * '[mark]' if the person is only known to have used a mark and it cannot be transcribed as a letter.
<includeonly>[? {{{1|}}} ?]</includeonly><noinclude>See [[Help:Transcription conventions#Uncertain text]] for how to use this template.</noinclude>

<nowiki>{{Disambiguation page}}</nowiki>
It will display the name of the page in bold followed be the text ' can refer to:'.
After the template you should manually enter a list of links and explanations.</noinclude>

Allowed values are listed in [[:Category:Licences]].
